alert.note: Alert for Adams; Wilkinson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 7:51AM CST until March 25 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...Louisiana... Mississippi River At Natchez affecting Wilkinson, Concordia and Adams Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, MARCH 25... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Natchez. * WHEN...Until Friday, March 25. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, Carthage Point Road becomes impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 48.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM CST Thursday was 48.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 49.0 feet Saturday, March 19. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, March 24. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mississippi River Natchez 48.0 48.1 Thu 6 am CST 48.2 48.3 48.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CST.
